findUnique.title: Find Unique
findUnique.delimiterDescription: Set a delimiting symbol or regular expression.
findUnique.trimItemsDescription: Remove leading and trailing spaces before comparing items.
findUnique.skipEmptyItemsDescription: Don't include the empty list items in the output.
findUnique.findAbsolutelyUniqueItemsDescription: Display only those items of the list that exist in a single copy.
findUnique.caseSensitiveItemsDescription: Output items with different case as unique elements in the list.

wrap.title: Wrap List
wrap.description: Add text before and after each list item.
wrap.joinSeparatorDescription: Separator to join the wrapped list
wrap.leftTextDescription: Text to add before each item
wrap.rightTextDescription: Text to add after each item

toolInfo.title: List Wrapping
toolInfo.description: This tool allows you to add text before and after each item in a list. You can specify different text for the left and right sides, and control how the list is processed. It's useful for adding quotes, brackets, or other formatting to list items, preparing data for different formats, or creating structured text.

sort.splitSeparatorDescription: Set a delimiting symbol or regular expression.

symbol.title: Use a Symbol for Splitting
symbol.description: Delimit input list items with a character.

regex.title: Use a Regex for Splitting
regex.description: Delimit input list items with a regular expression.

sort.caseSensitiveDescription: Sort uppercase and lowercase items separately. Capital letters precede lowercase letters in an ascending list. (Works only in alphabetical sorting mode.)
sort.joinSeparatorDescription: Use this symbol as a joiner between items in a sorted list.

group.splitSeparatorDescription: Set a delimiting symbol or regular expression.

symbol.title: Use a Symbol for Splitting
symbol.description: Delimit input list items with a character.

regex.title: Use a Regex for Splitting
regex.description: Delimit input list items with a regular expression.

group.groupNumberDescription: Number of items in a group
group.deleteEmptyItemsDescription: Ignore empty items and don't include them in the groups.
group.padNonFullGroupsDescription: Fill non-full groups with a custom item (enter below).
group.paddingCharDescription: Use this character or item to pad non-full groups.

toolInfo.title: List Duplication
toolInfo.description: This tool allows you to duplicate items in a list. You can specify the number of copies (including fractional values), control whether items are concatenated or interweaved, and even reverse the duplicated items. It's useful for creating repeated patterns, generating test data, or expanding lists with predictable content.

duplicate.joinSeparatorDescription: Separator to join the duplicated list
duplicate.concatenateDescription: Concatenate copies (if unchecked, items will be interweaved)

simple.title: Simple duplication
simple.description: This example shows how to duplicate a list of words.

reverse.title: Reverse duplication
reverse.description: This example shows how to duplicate a list in reverse order.

interweave.title: Interweaving items
interweave.description: This example shows how to interweave items instead of concatenating them.

fractional.title: Fractional duplication
fractional.description: This example shows how to duplicate a list with a fractional number of copies.

toolInfo.title: What Is a List Reverser?
toolInfo.description: With this utility, you can reverse the order of items in a list. The utility first splits the input list into individual items and then iterates through them from the last item to the first item, printing each item to the output during the iteration. The input list may contain anything that can be represented as textual data, which includes digits, numbers, strings, words, sentences, etc. The input item separator can also be a regular expression. For example, the regex /[;,]/ will allow you to use items that are either comma- or semicolon-separated. The input and output list items delimiters can be customized in the options. By default, both input and output lists are comma-separated. Listabulous!

reverse.itemSeparatorDescription: Set a delimiting symbol or regular expression.

symbol.title: Use a Symbol for Splitting
symbol.description: Delimit input list items with a character.

regex.title: Use a Regex for Splitting
regex.description: Delimit input list items with a regular expression.

shuffle.title: Shuffle
shuffle.delimiterDescription: Set a delimiting symbol or regular expression.
shuffle.joinSeparatorDescription: Use this separator in the randomized list.
